| Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | perpetuale + mente | | | | Osanna | | | | sbernare | | | | con | | | | tre | | | | melodia | | | | che | | | | suonare | | | | in | | | | tre | | | | ordine | | | | di | | | | letizia | | | | onde | | | | internare + si | | |

query.prompt:
For each row in the table, look up the etymology of the word. In the "Derived" column, write Latin, Greek, Germanic, etc. In the "Etymology" column, fill in the corresponding word in Greek, Latin, or others, but leave blank if unknown.
| Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | in | | | | esso | | | | gerarchia | | | | essere | | | | il | | | | altro | | | | dea | | | | primo | | | | Dominazione | | | | e | | | | poi | | | | Virtù | | | | il | | | | ordine | | | | terzo | | | | di | | | | Podestà | | | | essere | | |
query.result:
| Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | in | Latin | in | | esso | Latin | ipse | | gerarchia | Greek | hierarkhia | | essere | Latin | esse | | il | Latin | ille | | altro | Latin | alter | | dea | Latin | dea | | primo | Latin | primus | | Dominazione | Latin | dominatio | | e | Latin | et | | poi | Latin | post | | Virtù | Latin | virtus | | il | Latin | ille | | ordine | Latin | ordo | | terzo | Latin | tertius | | di | Latin | de | | Podestà | Latin | potestas | | essere | Latin | esse |
**Note:**
* The etymology of "gerarchia" is ultimately from Greek, but it entered Italian via Latin. * The etymology of "dea" is uncertain, but it is possibly related to the Latin word "deus" (god). * The etymology of "Virtù" is from Latin, but the word is ultimately derived from the Proto-Indo-European root "*wer-" (to do, to make).

For each row in the table, look up the etymology of the word. In the "Derived" column, write Latin, Greek, Germanic, etc. In the "Etymology" column, fill in the corresponding word in Greek, Latin, or others, but leave blank if unknown.

query.result:
| Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | poi | Latin | post | | in + i | Latin | in + ille | | due | Latin | duo | | penultimo | Latin | paene + ultimus | | tripudio | Latin | tripus + -ium | | Principato | Latin | principatus | | e | Latin | et | | Arcangelo | Greek | αρχάγγελος (archangelos) | | si | Latin | se | | girare | Germanic | *werpan* | | il | Latin | ille | | ultimo | Latin | ultimus | | essere | Latin | esse | | tutto | Latin | totus | | di | Latin | de | | Angelico | Greek | αγγελικός (angelikos) | | ludo | Latin | ludus |
*Note: The etymology of "girare" is uncertain, but it is thought to be of Germanic origin, possibly related to the Old English word "weorpan", meaning "to throw" or "to turn".*
